name: David Letterman
monologue: President Obama made a surprise visit to the folks in Afghanistan. It turns out he was shooting an episode of “Undercover Boss.”

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Highlights of President Obama's Trip To Afghanistan

name: Jay Leno
monologue: President Obama made a surprise visit to Afghanistan this weekend. I guess after 14 months in Washington, he wanted to go somewhere where there was less fighting.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: It was a pretty quick trip. In fact, it happened so fast, Joe Biden didn’t even get a chance to say something stupid about it.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Well, the people have spoken, but healthcare passed anyway.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Osama bin Laden has released a new audio tape in which he threatens to kill Americans, as opposed to his earlier new age, motivational tapes.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Happy Birthday to Lady Gaga. This weekend, she turned 24 years old. Her friends planned to jump out and yell “Surprise,” but it turns out the plant they were hiding behind was actually Lady Gaga.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A 74-year-old man just became the oldest father in Britain after his wife had a baby boy. They even named the baby after him: "Grandpa."

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A 96-year-old man in Taiwan just got married to a 30-year-old woman. They say what makes it work is having similar interests. She likes going to movies and doing crossword puzzles, and he likes doing anything that's not dying.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: On Saturday, two Mets fans became the first couple to have their wedding reception at Citi Field. You could tell it was the Mets’ Citi Field because when the bride tossed the bouquet, nobody caught it.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Sarah Palin has been campaigning for select Republicans including John McCain, who’s in a tough Senate race in Arizona. How does he introduce her? “And now the young woman who cost me the presidency . . . ”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The first of Apple’s much anticipated iPads are supposed to be delivered Saturday. Unfortunately, the demand is so high, they’ve had to push their pre-order deliveries back to April 12, just in time to announce the iPad II.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Snoop Dogg was on “Larry King Live” the other night. I’m still not sure why, but it was great.
